info.description: Grouper Web Service operations.  Substitute vX_Y_AAA with the client version, e.g. v2_6_001.  Note: the base URL and authentication are institution specific.
info.title: Grouper Web Services

post.description:
Sample 1: Find by substring in a folder
POST /grouper-ws/servicesRest/v2_6_001/groups
{
  "WsRestFindGroupsRequest":{
    "wsQueryFilter":{
      "queryFilterType":"FIND_BY_GROUP_NAME_APPROXIMATE",
      "stemName":"aStem",
      "groupName":"aGr"
    }
  }
}

Sample 1: Find by substring in a folder
POST /grouper-ws/servicesRest/v2_6_001/groups
wsLiteObjectType=WsRestFindGroupsLiteRequest&groupName=aGr&queryFilterType=FIND_BY_GROUP_NAME_APPROXIMATE&stemName=aStem

parameters.name: wsLiteObjectType
parameters.description: WsRestFindGroupsLiteRequest

parameters.name: clientVersion
parameters.description: Version of the client (i.e. that the client was coded against)

parameters.name: queryFilterType
parameters.description: findGroupType is the WsQueryFilterType enum for which type of find is happening: e.g. FIND_BY_GROUP_UUID, FIND_BY_GROUP_NAME_EXACT, FIND_BY_STEM_NAME, FIND_BY_APPROXIMATE_ATTRIBUTE, FIND_BY_ATTRIBUTE,  FIND_BY_GROUP_NAME_APPROXIMATE, FIND_BY_TYPE, AND, OR, MINUS
parameters.x-example: FIND_BY_GROUP_UUID | FIND_BY_GROUP_NAME_EXACT | FIND_BY_STEM_NAME | FIND_BY_APPROXIMATE_ATTRIBUTE | FIND_BY_ATTRIBUTE | FIND_BY_GROUP_NAME_APPROXIMATE | FIND_BY_TYPE | AND | OR | MINUS

parameters.name: groupName
parameters.description: groupName search by group name (must match exactly), cannot use other params with this

parameters.name: stemName
parameters.description: Will return groups only in this stem (by name)

parameters.name: stemNameScope
parameters.description: if searching by stem, ONE_LEVEL is for one level, ALL_IN_SUBTREE will return all in sub tree. Default is ALL_IN_SUBTREE

parameters.name: groupUuid
parameters.description: groupUuid search by group uuid (must match exactly)

parameters.name: groupAttributeName
parameters.description: This is the attribute name, or null for search all attributes.  This could be a legacy attribute or an attributeDefName of a string valued attribute

parameters.name: groupAttributeValue
parameters.description: The attribute value to filter on if querying by attribute and value

parameters.name: groupTypeName
parameters.description: not implemented

parameters.name: actAsSubjectId
parameters.description: If allowed to act as other users (e.g. if a UI uses the Grouper WS behind the scenes), specify the user subjectId to act as here.  Mutually exclusive with actAsSubjectIdentifier (actAsSubjectId is preferred)

parameters.name: actAsSubjectSourceId
parameters.description: If allowed to act as other users (e.g. if a UI uses the Grouper WS behind the scenes), specify the subject source ID (get this from the UI or your Grouper admin)

parameters.name: actAsSubjectIdentifier
parameters.description: If allowed to act as other users (e.g. if a UI uses the Grouper WS behind the scenes), specify the user subjectIdentifier to act as here.  Mutually exclusive with actAsSubjectId (preferred)

parameters.name: includeGroupDetail
parameters.description: If the group detail should be returned, default to false

parameters.name: paramName0
parameters.description: Optional params for this request

parameters.name: paramValue0
parameters.description: Optional params for this request

parameters.name: paramName1
parameters.description: Optional params for this request

parameters.name: paramValue1
parameters.description: Optional params for this request

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size if paging

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Page number 1 indexed if paging

parameters.name: sortString
parameters.description: Must be an hql query field, e.g. can sort on name, displayName, extension, displayExtension

parameters.name: ascending
parameters.description: T or null for ascending, F for descending.  If you pass true or false, must pass a sort string

parameters.name: typeOfGroups
parameters.description: Comma separated type of groups can be an enum of TypeOfGroup, e.g. group, role, entity

parameters.name: pageIsCursor
parameters.description: T|F default to F.  if this is T then we are doing cursor paging

parameters.name: pageLastCursorField
parameters.description: Field that will be sent back for cursor based paging

parameters.name: pageLastCursorFieldType
parameters.description: Could be: string, int, long, date, timestamp

parameters.name: pageCursorFieldIncludesLastRetrieved
parameters.description: If cursor field is unique, this should be false.  If not, then should be true.  i.e. if should include the last cursor field in the next resultset

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: enabled is A for all, T or null for enabled only, F for disabled

groupResults.description: has 0 to many groups that match the query

resultMetadata.description: Result code, if success, status code, result message

responseMetadata.description: Server version, millis elapsed on server, and warnings

WsFindGroupsResults.description: Groups returned from the group find query

WsFindGroupsResultsWrapper.description: Response body when a findGroups is successful

WsFindGroupsResultsWrapperError.description: Response body when not successful contains error message and metadata

extension.description: System extension of group, the part to the right of last colon in name.  This is the 'ID' in the UI

typeOfGroup.description: type of group can be an enum of TypeOfGroup, e.g. group, role, entity

displayExtension.description: Display extension of group, the part to the right of last colon in display name.  This is the 'Name' in the UI

description.example: This group was created 1/2/2019 by John Smith for the Math department.
description.description: Description field of group should contain documentation about the group

displayName.description: Fully qualified display name of the group ('Path' in the UI).  This contains all display extensions of parent folders separated by colons

name.description: Fully qualified system name of the group ('ID Path' in the UI).  This contains all the system extensions of parent folders separated by colons

uuid.description: This is the unique unchanging opaque identifier of this group (max 40 chars)

alternateName.description: If there is an alternate name assigned to this group, it will be listed here

detail.description: If requested, these are the detail results of the group

enabled.description: if the group is enabled, T or F

enabledTime.description: Timestamp this group is enabled: yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss.SSS

disabledTime.description: Timestamp this group is disabled: yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss.SSS

WsGroup.description: Result of one group being retrieved

hasComposite.description: if this group has a composite member, T|F

leftGroup.description: Left group if this is a composite owner (note, detail will never be there in the leftGroup wsGroup)

rightGroup.description: Right group if this is a composite owner (note, detail will never be there in the rightGroup wsGroup)

typeNames.description: Legacy types for this group, comma-separated

attributeNames.description: Attribute names, not including the ones listed in the group result or detail

attributeValues.description: Attribute values, not including the ones listed in the group result or detail

compositeType.description: If this is a composite group, this is the composite type: UNION, COMPLEMENT, INTERSECTION

createSubjectId.description: ID of the subject that created this group

createTime.description: Create time in format: yyyy/mm/dd hh24:mi:ss.SSS

isCompositeFactor.description: If a composite member of another group 'T', else 'F'.  A composite group is composed of two groups and a set operator (stored in the grouper_composites table) (e.g. complement, intersection). A composite group has no immediate members. All subjects in a composite group are effective members.

modifySubjectId.description: ID of the subject that last modified this group's attributes

modifyTime.description: Last modified time for this group. yyyy/mm/dd hh24:mi:ss.SSS

WsGroupDetail.description: Detail of group if requested from user

uuid.description: UUID of the group to find ('UUID' from the UI)

groupName.description: Group system name ('ID path' on UI) to search for, not the display name

WsGroupLookup.description: Template to lookup a group: groupName, uuid, and idIndex are mutually exclusive.

typeOfGroups.description: Comma separated type of groups can be an enum of TypeOfGroup, e.g. group, role, entity

sortString.description: Must be an hql query field, e.g. can sort on name, displayName, extension, displayExtension

ascending.description: T or null for ascending, F for descending.  If you pass true or false, must pass a sort string

queryFilterType.example: FIND_BY_GROUP_UUID | FIND_BY_GROUP_NAME_EXACT | FIND_BY_STEM_NAME | FIND_BY_APPROXIMATE_ATTRIBUTE | FIND_BY_ATTRIBUTE | FIND_BY_GROUP_NAME_APPROXIMATE | FIND_BY_TYPE | AND | OR | MINUS
queryFilterType.description: findGroupType is the WsQueryFilterType enum for which type of find is happening: e.g. FIND_BY_GROUP_UUID, FIND_BY_GROUP_NAME_EXACT, FIND_BY_STEM_NAME, FIND_BY_APPROXIMATE_ATTRIBUTE, FIND_BY_ATTRIBUTE,  FIND_BY_GROUP_NAME_APPROXIMATE, FIND_BY_TYPE, AND, OR, MINUS

groupName.description: groupName search by group name (must match exactly), cannot use other params with this

stemName.description: Will return groups only in this stem (by name)

stemNameScope.description: if searching by stem, ONE_LEVEL is for one level, ALL_IN_SUBTREE will return all in sub tree. Default is ALL_IN_SUBTREE

groupUuid.description: groupUuid search by group uuid (must match exactly)

groupAttributeValue.description: The attribute value to filter on if querying by attribute and value

groupAttributeName.description: This is the attribute name, or null for search all attributes.  This could be a legacy attribute or an attributeDefName of a string valued attribute

queryFilter0.description: If 'and' or 'or' this is the first group, and if complement, this is the group to complement

queryFilter1.description: if 'and' or 'or', this is the second group

pageIsCursor.description: T|F default to F.  if this is T then we are doing cursor paging

pageLastCursorField.description: Field that will be sent back for cursor based paging

pageLastCursorFieldType.description: Could be: string, int, long, date, timestamp

pageCursorFieldIncludesLastRetrieved.description: If cursor field is unique, this should be false.  If not, then should be true.  i.e. if should include the last cursor field in the next resultset

enabled.description: enabled is A for all, T or null for enabled only, F for disabled

queryTerm.description: queryTerm if searching by query, this is a term that will be matched to name, extension, etc

WsQueryFilter.description: this represents a query which can be and'ed or or'ed.  Can also pass in other params.

resultWarnings.description: If there are warnings, they will be here

millis.description: Milliseconds this operation took on server

serverVersion.description: The version of Grouper on the server

clientVersion.description: Version of the client (i.e. that the client was coded against)

actAsSubjectLookup.description: If allowed to act as other users (e.g. if a UI uses the Grouper WS behind the scenes), specify the user to act as here

includeGroupDetail.description: If the group detail should be returned, default to false

wsGroupLookups.description: wsGroupLookups if you want to just pass in a list of uuids and/or names.  Note the groups are returned in alphabetical order

WsRestFindGroupsRequest.description: bean that will be the data from rest request for finding groups
Identifies the request as a findGroups request

resultCode.description: This set of result codes is dependent on which operation is called and the status

resultCode2.description: If a second result code is needed for the operation and status, it will be listed here

resultMessage.description: Error message if there is an error

success.description: T or F as to whether it was a successful operation.  i.e. if there was a problem this will be F

WsResultMeta.description: Result code, if success, status code, result message

resultMetadata.description: Result code, if success, status code, result message

responseMetadata.description: Server version, millis elapsed on server, and warnings

WsResultsError.description: Response when not successful contains error message and metadata

subjectId.description: subjectId is mutually exclusive with subjectIdentifier.  This is specific to your institution.  Might be the employeeId.  You should also pass in a subjectSourceId

subjectIdentifier.description: subjectIdentifier is mutually exclusive with subjectId.  This is specific to your institution.  Might be the netId.  If you can use subjectId, you should use that, if not, use this.  You should also pass in a subjectSourceId

subjectSourceId.description: subjectSourceId is specific to your institution.  Ask your Grouper admins which subjectSourceId to you, or can find it in the UI where you import subjects

WsSubjectLookup.description: template to lookup a subject.  note if subjectId and subjectIdentifier are filled in with the same value, it will find by subject id or identifier.  To lookup a group as a subject use g:gsa as the source id, then either use the group uuid (e.g. fa2dd790-d3f9-4cf4-ac41-bb82e63bff66) in the subject id of the subject lookup, or the group system name as the subject identifier.
